channel.title: Java Terminology
channel.description:
Here are some basic terms used in the coding of the Java Language. I hope this helps your expand your knowledge
[quote="blakdaddy"]i didnt c+p it, i didnt take credit because you can basicly find it anywhere, but some people are too lazy to look[/quote] i typed this out, took me about 20 mins of typing, because i had it all done, and then my page reset without saving lol
[size=13pt][b]Term: [/b] [/size] [size=12pt][i]What It Does:[/i][/size]
[b]Boolean:[/b] [i]Indicates that a value is either true, or false[/i] [b]Break:[/b] [i]Jumps out of a loop.[/i] [b]Case: [/b] [i]Introduces one of several possible paths of execution in a switch (see switch) statement.[/i] [b]Switch:[/b] [i]Tells your computer to follow one of many possible paths of execution, depending on the value of an expression[/i] [b]Catch: [/b] [i]Introduces statements that are executed when something interrupts the flow of execution in a TRY (see try) clause.[/i] [b]Try: [/b] [i]Introduces statements that are watched during runtime for things that can go wrong[/i] [b]Class: [/b] [i] Introduces a class. (a Blue Print of an object)[/i] [b]Continue:[/b] [i]Forces and abrupt end of the current loop iteration and begins another iteration.[/i] [b]Default: [/b] [i]Introduces a path of execution to take when no case is a match in a switch statement.[/i] [b]Do: [/b] [i]Causes the computer to repeat some statements over and over.[/i] [b]Else:[/b] [i]Introduces statements that are executed when the condition in an IF (see If) statement isn't true.[/i] [b]If: [/b] [i]Tests to see whether a condition is true. If it's true, the computer executes certain statements; otherwise, the computer executes other statements.[/i]
[b]Extends:[/b] [i]Creates a subclass - a class that reuses functionality from a previously defined class.[/i] [b]Final: [/b] [i]Indicates that a variable's value cannot be changed, that a class's functionality cannot be extended, or that a method cannot be overridden.[/i] [b]Finally:[/b] [i]Introduces the last will and testament of the statements in a try clause.[/i] [b]Goto: [/b] [i]Cannot be used in a Java program, as it has no meaning in the Java Language.[/i] [b]If:[/b] [i]Tests to see whether a condition is true. If it's true, the computer executes certain statements. Otherwise, otherwise the computer executes other statements[/i]
[b]For: [/b] [i]Gets the computer to repeat some statements over and over again. (Like for a specified number of times)[/i] [b]Implements:[/b] [i]Reuses the functionality from a previously defined interface. (see interface)[/i] [b]Interface:[/b] [i]Introduces and interface, which is like a class, but less specific.[/i] [b]Import:[/b] [i]Enables the programmer to abbreviate the names of classes defined in a package.[/i] [b]Instanceof: [/b] [i]Tests to see whether a certain object comes from a certain class.[/i] [b]New: [/b] [i]Creates an object from an existing class.[/i] [b]Package:[/b] [i]Puts the code into a package - a collection of logically related definitions.[/i] [b]Private:[/b] [i]Indicates that a variable or method can be used only within a certain class.[/i] [b]Public:[/b] [i]Indicates that a variable, class or method can be used by any other java code.[/i] [b]Protected:[/b] [i]Indicates that a variable or method can be used in subclasses from another package.[/i] [b]Return:[/b] [i]Ends the execution of a method and possibly returns a value to the calling code.[/i] [b]Static: [/b] [i]Indicates that a variable or method belongs to a class, rather then to any object created from the class.[/i] [b]Switch:[/b] [i]Tells the computer to follow one of many possible paths of executions, depending on the value of an expression.[/i] [b]Synchronized:[/b] [i]keeps two threads from interfering with one another.[/i] [b]This:[/b] [i]Used a personal reference.[/i] [b]Throw:[/b] [i]creates a new exception object and indicates that an unwanted situation has occurred.[/i] [b]Throws:[/b] [i]Indicates that a method or constructor may pass the buck when an exception is thrown.[/i] [b]Void: [/b] [i]Indicates that a method doesn't return a value.[/i] [b]While: [/b] [i]Repeats some statements over and over again as long as a condition is still true.[/i]
I am still adding words, if you see that i have missed a word please feel free to post it and i will add it in. FIXED spelling and grammar mistakes

item.title: Java Terminology
item.dc:creator: @pregg pregg
item.description:
@pregg wrote:

[quote=“blakdaddy, post:1, topic:123585”]Here are some basic terms used in the coding of the Java Language.
I hope this helps your expand your knowledge

i didnt c+p it, i didnt take credit because you can basicly find it anywhere, but some people are too lazy to look

i typed this out, took me about 20 mins of typing, because i had it all done, and then my page reset without saving lol

[size=13pt]Term: [/size] [size=12pt]What It Does:[/size]

Boolean: Indicates that a value is either true, or false
Break: Jumps out of a loop.
Case: Introduces one of serveral possible paths of execution in a switch(see switch)statement.
Switch: Tells your computer to follow one of many possible paths of execution, depending on the value of an expression
Catch: Introduces statements that are executed when somthing interrupts the flow of execution in a TRY (see try) clause.
Try: Introduces statemetns that are watched during runtime for things that can go wrong
Class: Introduces a class. (Basicly a Blue Print of an object)
Continue: Forces and abrupt end of the current loop iteration and begins another interation.
Default: Introduces a path of execution to take when no case is a match in a switch statement.
Do: Causes the computer to repeat some statements over and over.
Else: Introduces statements that are executed when the condition in an IF (see If) statement isnt true.
If: Tests to see whether a condition is true. If its true, the computer executes certain statements; otherwise, the computer executes other
statements.

Extends: Creates a subclass - a class that reuses functionality from a previously definded class.
Final: Indicates that a variable’s value cannot be changed, that a class’s functionality cannot be extended, or that a method cannot be overridden.
Finally: Introduces the last will and testament of the statements in a try clause.
Goto: Cannot be used in a Java program, as it has no meaning in the Java Language.
If: Tests to see wheather a condition is true. If its true, the computer executes certain statements. Otherwise, otherwise the computer executes other statements

For: Gets the computer to repeat some statements over and over again. (Like for a specified number of times)
Implements: Reuses the functionality from a previously defined interface. (see interface)
Interface: Introduces and interface, which is like a class, but less specific.
Import: Enables the programer to abbreviate the names of classes defined in a package.
Instanceof: Tests to see whether a certain object comes from a certain class.
New: Creates an object from an existing class.
Package: Puts the code into a package - a collection of logically related definitions.
Private: Indicates that a variable or method can be used only within a certain class.
Public: Indicates that a variable, class or method can be used by any other java code.
Protected: Indicates that a variable or method can be used in subclasses from another package.
Return: Ends the execution of a method and possiby returns a value to the calling code.
Static: Indicates that a variable or method belongs to a class, rather then to any object created from the class.
Switch: Tells the computer to follow one of many possible paths of executions, depending on the value of an expression.
Synchronized: keeps two threads from interfering with one another.
This: Used a personal reference.
Throw: creates a new exception object and indicates that an unwanted situation has occured.
Throws: Indicates that a method or constructior may pass the buck when an exception is thrown.
Void: Indicates that a method doesnt return a value.
While: Repeats some statements over and over aagain as long as a condition is still true.

I am still adding words, if you see that i have missed a word please feel free to post it and i will add it in.[/quote] you miss spelled statemetns, Basicly, interation, definded, programer, Instanceof, constructior,aagain <3 fire fox spell check

Read full topic
